workflow.name: Agentic B2B lead enrichment from Google Search to Google Sheets
workflow.description:
## How it works

This is an advanced "Agentic" workflow that acts as an autonomous lead generation specialist. It goes beyond simple scraping by "thinking" about where to look for contact info.

1. **Search & Filter:** It performs a Google Search for your niche (e.g., "Marketing Agencies in Toronto"), normalizing results to remove directories (Clutch, Yelp) and junk links.
2. **Homepage Analysis:** It visits every lead's website and uses an AI Agent to identify key pages (Contact, About, Careers) and social profiles.
3. **Deep Scan (Branch A):** If a "Contact Us" page is found, a second AI Agent visits that specific page to extract hidden emails and phone numbers.
4. **LinkedIn Enrichment (Branch B):** Simultaneously, if a LinkedIn profile is found, it scrapes the profile to extract Company Size, Industry, and Headquarters location.
5. **Aggregation:** Finally, it merges data from all sources, formats the arrays into readable text, and saves the complete profile to Google Sheets.

## Set up steps

1. **Configure APIs:**
   * **Serper.dev:** Required for the initial Google Search results.
   * **ScraperAPI:** Required to bypass bot detection when visiting company websites and LinkedIn.
   * **Google Gemini (or OpenAI):** Required for the AI Agents to analyze HTML.

2. **Setup Google Sheet:**
   * Create a new Sheet with these exact headers in Row 1: `Company Name`, `Linked Summary`, `employee count`, `industry`, `Emails`, `Phone`, `Website`.
   * Connect the **Google Sheets** node to this file.

3. **Configure Variables:**
   * In the **Edit Fields** node (Start), enter your `search_query` (e.g., "Plumbers in Chicago").

4. **Important Note:**
   * This workflow uses a **Loop** with a 1.5s wait time to be polite to servers. A batch of 50 leads will take approximately 10-15 minutes to complete.

assignments.name: search_query
assignments.value: Marketing and Advertising agencies in Canada

parameters.content:
## 1. Search & Initialize
Defines the target niche and executes a Google Search to get raw results.

## 2. Clean & Loop
Filters out directories (like Yelp) to save AI credits, then starts a polite loop (1.5s delay) to process leads one by one.

## 3. Homepage Analysis
Scrapes the main website. The AI Agent reads the HTML to find hidden "Contact Us" sub-pages and social media links.

## 4. Contact Page Scan
If a specific "Contact Us" page was found, this branch visits it to extract emails and phone numbers hidden in the code.

parameters.message: =The Extraction has been completed and google sheets has been filled with the extracted data from the scrapers
parameters.subject: Extraction Completed

parameters.content:
## 5. LinkedIn Enrichment
If a LinkedIn profile was found, this branch scrapes it to gather company stats (Size, Industry, HQ).

## 6. Merge & Save
Consolidates data from all branches, formats lists (like multiple emails) into text, and saves to Google Sheets.

## üïµÔ∏è Overview
This is an "Agentic" lead generation workflow that behaves like a human researcher, not just a dumb scraper. It turns a simple Google Search into a verified lead list.

1. **Smart Search:** It searches Google for your niche (e.g., "Web Agencies in Toronto") 
2. **Homepage Scout:** An AI Agent visits every company website to identify the *correct* "Contact Us" page and look for LinkedIn profiles.
3. **Deep Dive (Parallel Processing):**
   - **Branch A:** Visits the specific Contact page to extract hidden emails and phone numbers.
   - **Branch B:** Visits the LinkedIn company profile to grab headcount, industry, and location data.
4. **Aggregation:** Merges all data, formats it into a clean row, and saves it to Google Sheets.

## ‚öôÔ∏è Setup steps
1. **Credentials:** You need **Serper** (Search), **ScraperAPI** (Proxy/Bypassing), and **Google Gemini** (Intelligence).
2. **Google Sheet:** Create a new sheet with these exact headers in Row 1:
   `Company Name`, `Linked Summary`, `employee count`, `industry`, `Emails`, `Phone`, `Website`
3. **Configuration:**
   - Open the **Edit Fields** node (Start).
   - Enter your keyword in the `search_query` field.
4. **Run:** The workflow uses a loop with a 1.5s delay to be polite to servers. A batch of 50 leads takes ~10-15 mins.

parameters.text: =Analyze this page and give me the Details of this linked profile or company :  {{ $json.data }}

messageValues.message: =## System Prompt You are an expert at analyzing the data from a LinkedIn company page. Your goal is to extract key business information.  ## Your Task Analyze the provided data and extract the following details. If a detail is not present, use an empty string "" or null.  ## Output Format You MUST output a single, clean JSON object. Do not use markdown. {   "linkedin_summary":,   "employee_count": ,   "industry": ,   "headquarters":    "email":. "contact  details":, "adresss":, }

parameters.text: =Analyze the following HTML and extract all contact details:  {{ $json.data }}

messageValues.message:
=## System Prompt
You are a specialist data extractor. Your only goal is to find email addresses and phone numbers within the provided HTML of a company's contact page.

## Your Task
1.  Meticulously scan the entire HTML for any email addresses (mailto: links or plain text) and any phone numbers (tel: links or plain text in various formats).
2.  If you cannot find any direct emails or phone numbers, check for the presence of a contact form (look for <form> tags associated with text like "contact us," "send a message," or "get in touch").
3.  You MUST output your findings as a single, clean JSON object. Do not provide any text, explanation, or markdown fences before or after the JSON.

## Output Format
Your entire output must be ONLY the JSON object, structured exactly like this:
{
  "emails": ["email@example.com", "another@example.com"],
  "phones": ["+1-555-123-4567", "(555) 987-6543"],
  "contact_form_present": true,
  "summary": "Found two emails and a contact form on the page."
}

## Rules
- If no emails are found, the "emails" array should be empty: [].
- If no phone numbers are found, the "phones" array should be empty: [].
- If no contact form is detected, "contact_form_present" should be false.
- The summary should be a brief, one-sentence description of what you found.

parameters.text: =Analyze the following HTML and extract all contact details: {{ $json.data }}

messageValues.message:
=## System Prompt
You are an expert-level Data Extraction Bot. Your sole purpose is to meticulously analyze raw HTML content from a company's webpage and extract every possible piece of contact information. You must be thorough, accurate, and systematic in your approach.

## Your Task

You will be given raw HTML as input. Your task is to parse this HTML and identify all contact details. You must then structure this information into a single, clean Markdown table.

## Information to Extract

You must find the following types of information:

Contact-Related Page Links:

Scour all <a> tags.

Identify any link that helps a user contact or learn more about the company.

Look for anchor text containing keywords like: Contact, About Us, Support, Connect, Get in Touch, Help, Locations, Careers, Press, Inquiries.

Extract the full, absolute URL from the href attribute. If the link is relative (e.g., /contact), construct the full URL based on the main website's domain.

Capture the link's anchor text (the visible text of the link).

Email Addresses:

Search for all mailto: links within href attributes.

Scan the entire text content of the HTML for email address patterns (e.g., name@domain.com). Be thorough, as they are often not in <a> tags.

Phone Numbers:

Search for all tel: links within href attributes.

Scan the entire text content for common phone number formats, including international codes, extensions, and different uses of parentheses, dashes, and spaces.

Physical Addresses:

Look for structured address formats, often found in the page <footer> or within elements with classes like address or location.

Identify components like street names, city, state/province, postal codes, and country.

Pay attention to schema.org/PostalAddress microdata if present.

Other Contact Methods:

Social Media: Extract links to primary social media platforms like LinkedIn, X (Twitter), Facebook, Instagram, etc.

Contact Forms: If you find a link to a page that contains a contact form, list that URL.

## Output Format

You MUST format your entire output as a 

  {
    "Contact Method": "Contact Page Link",
    "Detail": "https://www.tmpb2b.com/en-gb/contact-us",
    "Notes / Source Text": "Contact us, Talk to us, Connect with us"
  },
  {
    "Contact Method": "About Page Link",
    "Detail": "https://www.tmpb2b.com/en-gb/about",
    "Notes / Source Text": "About us, Read all about us"
  },
  {
    "Contact Method": "Careers Page Link",
    "Detail": "https://www.tmpb2b.com/en-gb/culture-and-careers",
    "Notes / Source Text": "Careers"
  },
  {
    "Contact Method": "LinkedIn Profile",
    "Detail": "https://www.linkedin.com/company/the-marketing-practice/posts/?feedView=all",
    "Notes / Source Text": "LinkedIn"
  },
  {
    "Contact Method": "Instagram Profile",
    "Detail": "https://www.instagram.com/themarketingpractice/?hl=en",
    "Notes / Source Text": "Instagram"
  }

so it flows well in n8n 


If you dont get any available emails on the home page  then write no emails found on email page but only after a thorough check to never miss onee !

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
